title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information       World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument (VALR) operates the Pearl Harbor Visitor Center, the portal for all visitors to Pearl Harbor. It consistently ranks among the top three most heavily-visited tourist destinations in the State of Hawai'i.  Each year, about 1.6 million visitors come from all over the world to see the USS Arizona Memorial, the USS Oklahoma Memorial, and the USS Utah Memorial, as well as visit our partner sites. Here you'll find out how to plan your trip to VALR!         Operating Hours and Seasons Here you'll find the monument's hours of operation, as well as information about our timed programs to the USS Arizona Memorial.          Fees and Passes Here is everything you need to know about getting tickets to the USS Arizona Memorial.         Permits and Reservations Here you can find out how to obtain a media permit, as well as how to make individual or group reservations.         Weather  Island weather can be very unpredictable! Find out how you can still come prepared.
